intro: Cylizoma, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Cylizoma thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
